paragraphs.content: Chapter 14
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 14

paragraphs.content: Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Every wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it down with her hands.

paragraphs.content: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the LORD: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that walketh in his uprightness feareth the Lord: but he that is perverse in his ways despiseth him.

paragraphs.content: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lips of the wise shall preserve them.

paragraphs.content: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increase is by the strength of the ox.

paragraphs.content: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A faithful witness will not lie: but a false witness will utter lies.

paragraphs.content: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledge is easy unto him that understandeth.

paragraphs.content: Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Go from the presence of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not in him the lips of knowledge.

paragraphs.content: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.

paragraphs.content: Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Fools make a mock at sin: but among the righteous there is favour.

paragraphs.content: The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The heart knoweth his own bitterness; and a stranger doth not intermeddle with his joy.

paragraphs.content: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The house of the wicked shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle of the upright shall flourish.

paragraphs.content: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

paragraphs.content: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.

paragraphs.content: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.

paragraphs.content: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.

paragraphs.content: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.

paragraphs.content: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.

paragraphs.content: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The simple inherit folly: but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.

paragraphs.content: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The evil bow before the good; and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.

paragraphs.content: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich hath many friends.

paragraphs.content: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that despiseth his neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy on the poor, happy is he.

paragraphs.content: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Do they not err that devise evil? but mercy and truth shall be to them that devise good.

paragraphs.content: In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lips tendeth only to penury.

paragraphs.content: The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolishness of fools is folly.

paragraphs.content: A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A true witness delivereth souls: but a deceitful witness speaketh lies.

paragraphs.content: In the fear of the LORD is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the fear of the Lord is strong confidence: and his children shall have a place of refuge.

paragraphs.content: The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life, to depart from the snares of death.

paragraphs.content: In the multitude of people is the king’s honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the multitude of people is the king’s honour: but in the want of people is the destruction of the prince.

paragraphs.content: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.

paragraphs.content: A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envy the rottenness of the bones.

paragraphs.content: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth his Maker: but he that honoureth him hath mercy on the poor.

paragraphs.content: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous hath hope in his death.

paragraphs.content: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.

paragraphs.content: Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Righteousness exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any people.

paragraphs.content: The king’s favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The king’s favour is toward a wise servant: but his wrath is against him that causeth shame.
